boat.name: Asti V
boat.full_description:
Asti V is an International 6 metre designed by Morgan Giles for the Spanish royal family to race in the 1932 Olympics. Built in 1930 in Bilboa at the yard of Hermano Sagredo by men transported over specially from Morgan Giles in England. She is constructed of Mahogany  on steamed oak frames. She was smuggled out of Spain as deck cargo to Maldon during the Spanish Civil War, and renamed Saxon in 1934. Originally sporting 3 open cockpits for crew, over the years the rig was altered and a large cabin built for family cruising by various owners. Under the name of Saxon she sailed at Burnham and with the Maldon Little Ship club.

Saxon was acquired in 1984 by Hartley and Brookes Boat Designs of Heybridge Basin, Maldon. They restored her original name, gutted the hull and removed the rig. A new rig and deck layout was designed by Colin Brookes with the work being carried out by Peter Brookes through the winter of 1984-5.

She was sold out of the OGA in 2003.
